headline: Apple's new MacBook Pro: YF breakdown
summary: On today's Tech Support segment, Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley takes a deep dive into Apple's newest 16-inch MacBook Pro. Howley provides a breakdown of the latest MacBook Pro features, including pricing across the entire MacBook lineup which starts at $1599. He also explains the Apple intelligence features integrated into this newest model and outlines the specific M4 chip variants associated with each device in the updated MacBook lineup. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Apple furthers smart home push with wall-mounted tablet: BBG
summary: According to a Bloomberg report, Apple (AAPL) plans to launch a wall-mounted AI tablet device as it expands into the smart home market. The new tablet will include features such as controlling home appliances and video conferencing. Catalysts Co-hosts Seana Smith and Madison Mills break down the details, discussing how it could compete with competitors like Amazon's (AMZN) Alexa. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Trump’s Tariff Proposal Could Add $240 to the Cost of an iPhone. Here’s the Math.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump’s love of tariffs could lead to big price hikes in the cost of an iPhone.  A 60% tariff on the imported portion of the price would therefore come to a tax on Apple of roughly $216 to $240 per iPhone 16, an effective rate of 27% to 30%.  President-elect Donald Trump has made it no secret that tariffs are one of his preferred economic policies.

raw.headline: Trump’s Tariff Proposal Could Add $240 to the Cost of an iPhone. Here’s the Math.

President-elect Donald Trump has made it no secret that tariffs are one of his preferred economic policies.

headline: Apple making foray into smart home IP camera market, says analyst Ming-Chi Kuo
summary: Apple (AAPL) is making its first foray into the smart home IP camera market, with mass production scheduled for 2026, targeting annual shipments in the tens of millions, says TF International Securities analyst Ming-Chi Kuo. Goertek has received the NPI and will be the exclusive assembly supplier, the analyst says. The smart home IP camera, scheduled for production in 2026, is designed to integrate seamlessly with other Apple hardware products via wireless connectivity. Current global smart home
